intro: Maytenus sellowii, commonly known as Brazilian henna or Brazilian mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red fruits that contain one or two seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Maytenus sellowii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
